York men's lacrosse firsts took another step towards promotion from division two with a convincing win over third-placed Leeds Metropolitan

Despite a spirited first half comeback, York women's hockey firsts lost 4-2 to Newcastle seconds on Wednesday afternoon

Despite local rivals York St John scoring first and the scores being level at half time, York dug deep in the second half to pull off a tremendous win

York men's badminton firsts came from two games down to salvage a draw against Sheffield Hallam, whilst the thirds won a crucial relegation match against Leeds

UYAFC were frustrated by a lack of precision in the final third as they were beaten 3-1 by Hull at the 3G

Men's volleyball lose out to Northumbria in close encounter

The York volleyball men's firsts fell marginally short of victory inside the chilly Sports Tent on Wednesday evening, as Northumbria's men's seconds team closed out a victory against the home side

Phenomenal serving streak propels York to volleyball victory

The York women's volleyball first team claimed a comprehensive 3-1 victory over Leeds Metropolitan this afternoon in the Sport Tent, with the highlight of the match undoubtedly being an incredible nineteen-point serving streak held by York's Jessica Goodsell.

Gallant women's rugby side thrash depleted Newcastle

York quickly adapted to a reduced team size and uncontested scrum rules to dominate play against an eleven-player and inexperienced Newcastle seconds side in the women's rugby on 22 acres this afternoon, winning 78-0.

Vanbrugh recovered from their horror show against Langwith last week and moved up to second in the table with a 2-1 victory over James on Sunday

Derwent miss chance to go top after stalemate

Derwent missed the chance to go top of the league with a game in hand after being held to a goalless draw by Wentworth on Sunday.

Birthday-boy Bugeja seals victory to lift Alcuin off the bottom

A Ben Bugeja wonder-strike in the dying minute of the game sealed victory for Alcuin on a sunny 22 Acres, allowing the Owls to leap-frog their opponents Langwith off the bottom of the table.
